author: CNN Newssource
title: Mother who is accused of killing her baby makes court appearance
text:
Mother who is accused of killing her baby makes court appearance
By Matt Wreden
Click here for updates on this story
BUTTE COUNTY, California (
KHSL) — A Chico woman appeared in Butte County Superior Court on June 6 regarding the fentanyl overdose death of her baby boy.
Christy Ann Scarbrough, 40, was charged by the Butte County District Attorney’s Office special victims’ unit for felony child abuse with a special allegation that the abuse resulted in the infant’s death.
Butte County District Attorney Mike Ramsey said Scarbrough found the boy face down in his crib on the evening of July 6, 2023, the boy’s first birthday. The child was blue and unresponsive. She took him to Enloe Hospital, where he was ultimately pronounced dead, Ramsey said.
An investigation by Chico police revealed there was a straw in the baby’s crib that tested positive for fentanyl. An extensive investigation was followed by the police and district attorney’s office, including an autopsy that showed an extraordinarily high amount of fentanyl in the infant’s gastric acid, indicating the baby ingested the fentanyl.
Ramsey said Scarbrough is an admitted fentanyl user. The use of a straw is a common method of adult ingestion of fentanyl, a powerful opioid.
“We have overdoses and here’s a child that obviously got into its mother’s stash of fentanyl and expired because of that,” Ramsey said.
Scarbrough was previously convicted of child abuse in 2013 and sentenced to prison when her then seven-week-old daughter tested positive for methamphetamine. Ramsey said it was alleged that Scarbrough was taking methamphetamine and other drugs while breastfeeding the child.
“Most significant prior conviction to what she was sentenced to state prison was eerily similar in the sense that time her seven-week-old baby was presented to the hospital very sick from methamphetamine overdose,” Ramsey said.
At the arraignment on June 6, Butte County Superior Court Judge Kristen Lucena held Scarbrough without bail. Scarbrough is due to return to court on June 20, 2024, at 8:30 a.m. to enter a plea. She faces up to 10 years in state prison.
Please note: This content carries a strict local market embargo. If you share the same market as the contributor of this article, you may not use it on any platform.

author: @herzindagi
title: Ghee To Cumin Seeds: 4 Kitchen Ingredients That Can Help You Manage Migraine - HerZindagi
text:
Ghee To Cumin Seeds: 4 Kitchen Ingredients That Can Help You Manage Migraine
While eating soaked raisins is good for immunity and digestion, it can also help you manage symptoms of migraine. Here are other kitchen ingredients that you can consume to manage the condition.
Do you often feel throbbing or pulsating pain in your head? It could be a migraine. While the diagnosis and treatment require the intervention of a doctor, there are a couple of ingredients in your kitchen that can help you manage the condition.
Dr Dixa Bhavsar Savaliya, Ayurvedic Expert and Co-founder of The Kadamba Tree, shared a reel on her Instagram highlighting the benefits of these ingredients in helping you experience relief.
Cumin Seeds And Cardamom Tea For Migraine
Cumin and cardamom are two spices in the kitchen associated with many health benefits, including flushing out toxins from the body. They promote digestion and help with weight loss too. However, this is probably the first time you must have read that a cup of tea containing these two ingredients can help you manage migraines.
Ingredients For Cumin-Cardamom Tea
- 1 coarsely crushed cardamom
- 1/2 teaspoon carom (ajwain) seeds
- 1 glass of water
- 5 mint leaves
- 1 teaspoon of cumin seeds
- 1 tablespoon coriander seeds
Method To Prepare Cumin-Cardamom Tea
- Add these ingredients to water and boil them for 3-5 minutes on medium flame.
- Strain the mixture and enjoy the tea an hour after lunch or dinner. You can also have it when you are experiencing migraine.
The expert mentioned in her caption that this tea recipe also works well in offering relief from stress and nausea. You can also have it before bed to improve sleep.
Soaked Raisins For Migraine
View this post on Instagram
You have to soak at least 10-15 raisins overnight and have them first thing in the morning. They are associated with alleviating symptoms of migraine and offering relief from the throbbing pain.
She added that if a person consumes them every day for at least 12 weeks, the ingredients can improve the overall well-being of the body. It also helps the body combat nausea, acidity, irritation, and one-sided headache.
Apart from this, soaked raisins or
soaked raisin water also has other benefits for your health, including detoxifying the liver, boosting immunity, aiding indigestion, helping with weight loss, improving bone strength, regulating blood pressure, and managing heart health.
Don't Miss:
Ayurvedic Expert Shares 8 Dil Se Indian Home Remedies To Combat Sore Throat In Winter
Cow Ghee For Migraine
According to the ayurvedic expert, no kitchen ingredient works like cow ghee, when it comes to creating a balance between mind and body. You can include it in your diet in a few ways,
- Add two drops of the ingredient to your nose
- Add to roti or cook vegetables in the ghee
- Have it with milk before bedtime
- Consume cow ghee with some ayurvedic medicines to combat migraine
It is loaded with vitamin A, which is essential for the immune and reproductive systems. The ingredient promotes healthy cell growth and is considered keto-friendly.
Omega-3 fatty acids in
cow ghee remove bad cholesterol from the body and ensure your heart remains healthy. It contains dairy fat and amino acids that ensure you are able to digest it without experiencing issues.
For more home remedies, stay tuned to HerZindagi.

author: Leo Collis
title: Alaska sets new temperature records amid severe heat wave: 'That just cannot happen here'
text:
Fears of record temperatures in Fairbanks, Alaska, were realized in late July, with thermometers hitting 90 degrees Fahrenheit .
What's happening? According to Scientific American , Alaska is experiencing an unusually warm period of weather because of a "strong bubble of warm air" and high pressure, as meteorologist Greg Michels detailed.
The hottest-ever July 22 was recorded, landing at 90 degrees Fahrenheit to beat the previous high of 89, as The Washington Post observed.
Michels noted that with fewer clouds in the sky, thanks to the high-pressure system, the sun's rays are uninhibited on the way down to Earth, making the air heat up quickly.
With the summer solstice on June 20 leaving a full two hours less daylight time for heat to accumulate by late July, the record high temperature is additionally concerning. While temperature highs are seen elsewhere in the United States during the summer months, climate scientist Brian Brettschneider told Scientific American "that just cannot happen here ... because you need that sun angle, the hours of daylight."
Why are record-high temperatures in Alaska concerning? Thermometers are hitting new highs across the globe , so it's not entirely surprising that Alaska is witnessing them, too. However, residents of the state are not equipped to deal with excessive heat, and public health warnings have been issued.
Watch now: Local hero single-handedly repopulates endangered butterfly species Homes are built to withstand the extreme colds that are typical in the area, so when the temperature creeps higher, trapping heat inside can become uncomfortable and potentially deadly.
Air conditioning units are flying off the shelves, as Uma Bhatt, a climate scientist at the University of Alaska Fairbanks, told Scientific American. While this is an effective method of cooling, these units require a lot of energy to run, putting a strain on the electricity grid in a time of high demand. This could result in power outages, causing additional problems for residents.
Air or heat pumps are an alternative method to cool (or heat) a property that requires significantly less energy, and they are much cheaper to run. With high temperatures perhaps a more regular occurrence, residents might want to look into the technology .
What should you do in excessive heat? Staying in air-conditioned areas and away from the outdoor heat is important to help regulate body temperature and avoid the risk of heat-related illnesses. However, air conditioning isn't as ubiquitous in Alaska as it is in other areas of the United States.
Community cooling areas, such as in public libraries or schools, are increasingly popular as temperatures creep upward, so finding these spots is an ideal way to beat the sun's blast.
Otherwise, avoiding strenuous activity, wearing lightweight clothing, and drinking lots of water is advised by UNICEF .
Join our free newsletter for cool news and cool tips that make it easy to help yourself while helping the planet.

author: Camila Méndez Sastoque
title: Los más pilas fueron reconocidas por MinEducación en 'La Noche de la Excelencia'
text:
Camila Méndez Sastoque• Colombia.com
Los más pilas fueron reconocidas por MinEducación en 'La Noche de la Excelencia'
La Noche de la Excelencia galardonó en 22 categorías a diferentes miembros de las instituciones educativas.
La Noche de la Excelencia galardonó en 22 categorías a diferentes miembros de las instituciones educativas.
La "Noche de la excelencia - somos la revolución del cambio", fue el evento celebrado por parte del Ministerio de Educación donde se reconocieron más de 300 miembros educativos por promover procesos académicos en Colombia.
El Ministerio de Educación nacional llevó a cabo el 4 de diciembre la apertura a la "Noche de la Excelencia", un evento que reconoce el esfuerzo, trabajo, dedicación, liderazgo y las buenas prácticas que se llevan a cabo durante el año en estos entornos educativos donde participaron estudiantes, docentes, rectores, directivos y demás miembros de las instituciones quienes tuvieron como fin crear estrategias de educación que promovieron la revolución en este entorno.
"Es un placer enorme que en esta noche en la que galardonamos la excelencia educativa hayamos podido sacar esta celebración de los salones fastuosos y de las lógicas tradicionales y nos encontremos aquí en la mítica e inspiradora Plaza Ché en la Universidad Pública. Cuando hablamos de premiar la excelencia estamos frente a maestros, alumnos, directivos, rectores y miembros de la comunidad que hacen un esfuerzo enorme para garantizar el derecho a la educación, más no para prestar el servicio a la educación, y en esto debe radicar la diferencia de cómo debe ser vista nuestra educación".
Se reconocieron a los mejores puntajes de las pruebas Saber 11
Este entonces llevó a cabo en la Universidad Nacional de Colombia en Bogotá, donde se brindó el reconocimiento público de los líderes en educación que hay en Colombia. Fueron más de 220 galardones en 22 categorías que se entregaron a los mejores resultados de las pruebas Saber 11 a nivel nacional y departamental, asimismo diferentes instituciones de educación superior lograron su acreditación institucional en alta calidad o colocaron en alto diferentes programas académicos.
La Noche de la excelencia 2024 aparte de ser un escenario y reconocimiento también fue el espacio ideal para que la cultura y la música fueran protagonistas, pues por medio de muestras de grafiti, apuestas en escena, conciertos y eventos culturales se visualizó la diversidad que hay en cada rincón de Colombia.
Para conocer la lista de todos los galardonados en esta noche de la excelencia podrás visitar la página web del ministerio de educación.

author: Chiara Fiorillo
title: Kanye West says he's 'training' daughter North West after launching clothing brand - NewsBreak
text:
By Chiara Fiorillo ,
17 minutes ago Kanye West said he has been "training" his daughter North West after announcing he is launching a new clothing brand .
The 47-year-old rapper shared a video of himself and his 11-year-old daughter in a recording studio, with the caption "TRAINING 3." Earlier this week, he had posted two more clips of North practicing her music skills with the help of her father and his team.
In the latest clip, Ye can be seen giving North some tips on how to sing some tunes and making her repeat some verses until she gets them perfectly. The young artist smiles and looks at her father as he teaches her some tricks of the trade.
READ MORE: Kanye West teams up with daughter North after being branded an 'absent father'
READ MORE: Kanye West goes head-to-head with Kim Kardashian as he launches brand inspired by Bianca Censori
Fans were excited to see the video on Ye's Instagram profile, as one wrote, "She's literally learning from the greatest artist of all time," before adding, "Her first album is about to be amazing." Another said, "Thank you North for giving Kanye back to us."
A third commented, "YE your father and your music teacher. What a lucky girl." Someone else commented, "Oh she gonna be a problem." And one more wrote, "Imagine Kanye being ur producer n executive producer n beatmaker n dad."
In a separate post this week, Kanye revealed North had asked him him to "make beats for her" as he credited his eldest child for making him "love music again." Sharing the news on social media, the musician said he made beats for North's album as well as for his own, BULLY.
He posted a black-and-white photo of North sitting on a chair in a music studio, with the caption, "This little girl made me love music again. She asked me to make beats for her I got back on the ASR Chopped up beats for her album and chopped every beats with my bare hand for BULLY ."
Kanye shares North, sons Saint and Psalm, and daughter Chicago with his ex-wife, Kim Kardashian. Ye's long-time collaborator Malik Yusef wrote in the comments, "Yes sir, you definitely did that. I've been a witness seen it with my own two eyes is really good to see the young God YE doing pure magic!!!!"
Meanwhile, Ye teased that a women's line for YZY is on the way, giving his ex-wife Kim - who is the founder of Skims - some competition. He posted a picture on Tuesday of one of the designs, a body suit, inspired by his wife, Bianca Censori . The design looks similar to one previously worn by Bianca , which features thin spaghetti straps and a revealing sheer black material.
He wrote in the caption, "Yzy women's coming next SCALING INNOVATION. For anyone in clothing that doesn't work at Yeezy be afraid Be very afraid. No corporations leveraging my platform Using me to get to get to us Overcharging our community while ignoring my vision and direction."
Ye continued, "Stopping the foam runners and Yeezy slides production during COVID only to copy the designs. People tried to tell me to go back to adidas. Of course they were people close enough to ask for money from me. They didn't care about my freedom or vision. Now my vision is coming to life and I have a John Wick vendetta against every fashion company as my fellow Gemini Tupac said Die m---f----r Die. Now play off the grid."
Click here to follow the Mirror US on Google News to stay up to date with all the latest news, sport and entertainment stories.

author: Eirinet Gómez, corresponsal
title: La Jornada - FGE de Veracruz entrega cuerpos recuperados de accidente aéreo ocurrido en julio
text:
Xalapa, Ver. Tras cinco meses del desplome de una aeronave frente a las costas de Veracruz-puerto, la Fiscalía General de Estado (FGE) entregó los restos de un pasajero y dos tripulantes que perdieron la vida en aquel siniestro.
La fiscal Verónica Hernández Giadáns, informó que la entrega de los restos se hicieron a través de la Fiscalía Regional Zona Centro Veracruz y la Dirección General de los Servicios Periciales, bajo protocolos de notificación y entrega digna aplicables en la materia.
Durante la entrega, el Director General de los Servicios Periciales, Héctor Ronzón García, dio la explicación detallada a cada familia de los resultados obtenidos de los diversos análisis forenses realizados. Y los familiares manifestaron estar de acuerdo con la metodología aplicada y los resultados obtenidos
El 28 de julio la aeronave Cessna 650 bimotor se desplomó frente al puerto de Veracruz. En su momento, los peritos especializados analizaron la forma de caída del avión bimotor y establecieron que pudo haberse estrellado a una velocidad entre 700 a 800 kilómetros por hora con el mar en una zona de poca profundidad (de 6 metros a 20 metros).
La Agencia Federal de Aviación Civil (AFAC) informó que la aeronave siniestrada había despegado aquel día, a las 20:49, del Aeropuerto Internacional Heriberto Jara Corona del puerto de Veracruz con destino al Aeropuerto Internacional de Toluca, estado de México.
A bordo de la aeronave iban el piloto Héctor Priego, el copiloto Jorge Gerardo Rubi, y Daniel Flores Nava, reconocido empresario y director de la empresa Proyecta, quien había visitado la entidad ese día para acompañar a Adán Augusto López, en un encuentro con militantes de Morena, en el centro de Veracruz.
Por este siniestro, la Fiscalía General del Estado inició la carpeta de investigación número VER/XVII/F1/3160/2023.

author: The Canadian Press
title: Warming trend forecast for West after record freeze, snow in forecast for Vancouver
text:
Warming trend forecast for West after record freeze, snow in forecast for Vancouver
A warming trend is in the forecast for much of British Columbia after several days of record-breaking temperatures, but the cold weather on the Prairies will continue.
Environment Canada says temperatures are rising but snow flurries are in the forecast for the Metro Vancouver area, followed by rain later this week and temperatures well above zero degrees Celsius.
Temperatures in Alberta are forecast to start to moderate today and through the week, but it will remain cold.
Calgary and Edmonton have been experiencing wind chills as high as -50 C over the weekend, but Environment Canada says the daily low temperatures will drop to -21 C.
Environment Canada says despite the somewhat warmer temperatures in Alberta, frostbite warnings will remain in effect.
B.C.’s public power utility, BC Hydro, says the extreme cold drove peak hourly electricity demand across the province to a record high on Friday night, reaching 11,300 megawatts.
This report by The Canadian Press was first published Jan. 15, 2024.

author: LISA RESPERS FRANCE, CNN
title: Cher files for conservatorship of son Elijah Blue Allman
text: Cher has filed for temporary legal conservatorship of her adult son Elijah Blue Allman, citing his alleged ongoing substance abuse issues. According to a petition filed this week in Los Angeles Superior Court and obtained by CNN, Cher is seeking to be the sole conservator of her son’s estate, alleging that he “is currently unable to manage his assets due to severe mental health and substance abuse issues.” “Elijah is entitled to regular distributions from the Trust, but given his ongoing mental health and substance abuse issues,” according to the documents. “Petitioner (Cher) is concerned that any funds distributed to Elijah will be immediately spent on drugs, leaving Elijah with no assets to provide for himself and putting Elijah’s life at risk.” The 47-year-old is the son of Cher and her former husband, the late rocker Gregg Allman. Gregg Allman and Cher were married from 1975 to 1979. He [died in 2017](https://www.cnn.com/2017/05/27/entertainment/gregg-allman-obituary/index.html) at the age of 69 due to liver cancer complications. The petition filed by Cher states that her son is set to receive funds from a trust by the end of the year. It also states that the 77-year-old singer and actress has “worked tirelessly to get Elijah into treatment and get him the help he needs.” “Petitioner (Cher) loves Elijah immensely and has always acted with his best interests in mind,” the filing states. “I’m not suffering from any problem that millions of people in the United States aren’t,” [Cher told People magazine](https://people.com/cher-speaks-out-on-kidnapping-plot-allegations-about-son-not-true-exclusive-8350230) in October, referring to her son’s substance abuse. “I’m a mother. This is my job — one way or another, to try to help my children,” she said. “You do anything for your children. Whenever you can help them, you just do it because that’s what being a mother is. But it’s joy, even with heartache — mostly, when you think of your children, you just smile and you love them, and you try to be there for them.” Cher is also the mother of Chaz Bono. A hearing has been scheduled in March, according to court documents. CNN is working to determine if Allman has legal representation. CNN has reached out to representatives for Cher for further comment.
